summary:
Data Science / Machine Learning / Quantitative Decision making enthusiast with a passion for data interpretation, and an academical background as a PhD researcher & an instructor in Industrial Engineering & Manufacturing Systems. My specialization is in Bayesian Theory. I have know-how on statistical inference, programming languages for business analytics, operations research methods and optimization techniques, marketing analytics, information visualization and various business intelligence tools. I am equipped with international experience in several different industries, and I have taken roles in several global research institutions, companies and start-ups.

Github: github.com/mtsvnc
Stackoverflow: stackoverflow.com/users/12247663/mtsvnc
Kaggle: kaggle.com/metesevinc

In my free time I enjoy attending the following activities;

- Outdoors & nature, experimental cooking, garden works, agricultural science.
- Weight Lifting : olympic lifting, deadlifts, squats, combinatorial full-body presses.
- Aquariums : Design & build, maintenance & filtration science, scaping & flow orientation, fish breeding.

--> Entrepreneur in house. 

Not your typical programmer / coder, I am more of a Data Science ambassador / evangelist. I attend conferences, develop ideas and turn them into scalable projects for various sectors, manage stakeholders & shareholders expectations, initiate projects and generate business. Those efforts eventually contribute to increasing profitability of TMC group.

profile_positions.description:
-	Completed “Data Scientist in Python” tutorial on Datacamp.com and was rewarded with a certification.
-	Developed Bayesian models for statistical A&B testing in marketing efforts of a leading Dutch insurance company.
-	Assisted in the development of marketing and revenue management methods for a sports retail giant. Bayesian networks for sales prediction, simulation & marketing insights. Knapsack optimization problem for product assortment, allocation of budget percentage for various segments of the products. (Coded in R).
-	Data Quality Assessment track of Connected Coffee Machine project for a leading Dutch coffee producer. Assessed the quality of data collected on 7k wireless coffee vending machines. Evaluated the beverage consumption and error reporting data. (Coded in R).
-	Development of Markov / Bayesian models for a leading British broadband company. Predictive & reactive network models for solving the CPD (common path distortion) problem in telecommunications. (Coded in R).
-	Completed “Bayesian Theory & Statistics” tutorial on Coursera.com, and was rewarded with a certification.
-        Received hands on experience for Machine Learning using Azure Cloud Technologies, trained by Microsoft Netherlands.
-        Web scrapping (Python).
-        Developed an extensive Data Science Glossary, the go-to for DS news, technical innovations, R & python libraries, self-study tutorials, announcement of workshops, personal DS blogs etc.

Tools in use: Python, R, SQL, Cloud tech.
